text: Hi guys, I am looking for a certain API to get all conversations with each user has logged on my application . It functions similar to the inbox/all conversation on HubSpot app. Can you help me?

Can the same app receive webhooks for multiple customers. For example we are a automation platform and we have an app. Can we receive webhooks on the same URL for all the customers that are connected to our platform or each customer needs to create an app and add the URL to receive webhooks.

From <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks>:
> Webhooks are set up for a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/how-do-i-create-an-app-in-HubSpot|HubSpot app>, not individual accounts. Any accounts that install your app (by going through the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/initiate-oauth-integration|OAuth flow>) will be subscribed to its webhook subscriptions.

Building out a custom form with the HubSpot api post method - the form sends when i only add the email field - but when i add all these other objects to the 'fields' array - i get a 400 response. Am I missing something simple here?

Hi all. I work for a communications company and we have a client that uses HubSpot as their CRM. They want us to pull new leads from their HubSpot and send them information from our system. What is the best way to go about that using the API? Do we need API credentials from inside the clients HubSpot CRM to access the API?
Re: something simple - didn't have the fields created in the actual HubSpot version of the form. Thursdays can still be mondays, amirite?

Hi Derrick, yes certainly you need an API key from their HubSpot account to pull the new leads. There are different ways you can do this, for example if you want to pull a new lead details soon after it is created in HubSpot, you jave to use HubSpot webhooks or workflows(depends on the customer subscription). 

If you go through HubSpot documentation on using the API to pull contact data or using the webhooks you will quickly acheive this on your own.

I can help you if you need urgent quick help and do not have time to go through the documentation.

Thanks
Hi Wilbert. No we have time. First I need to get credentials from the client. So where does the client need to go to get us API key credentials to access their account through the API?
Also, is there trigger abilities? In other words on HubSpot to say "When this happens, callout to an external web URL with these parameters"
This way instead of polling your API, we would get the data from HubSpot as it's created. If not that is ok.. just checking.
Great, so we need to find if the clients subscription type to see if they have webhooks or workflows?

Webhooks are always there for you but instead you ask you client to give you access to their HubSpot portal then you create your Developer account so that you will be able to create an app that will use webhooks. Check <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows>

Greetings. In reading the api docs at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts> it doesn't seem like we can update Contacts by email... is that only available in the `v1` api? Also, is there any sort of "upsert"-style functionality, or do we have to be specific in the call? In that case, in `v3` search can we specify multiple email addresses as filters to get functionality like SQL `IN` somehow? The documentation for `v3` search is very nice in exposing the expected body structure but it is not immediately clear to me what all of the parameters accomplish. (If these questions don't make it clear, I am very new to the HubSpot API)
I'm actually setting this up for the first time - as far as you're aware does HubSpot not pass the page uri or any other info about the submission automatically?
I guess I assumed it would pass any information the tracking script gathered along with the form data - but that does not seem to be the case
Not from what I’ve seen. Looks like its up to us to send along with the request. I’m just going to add that and the page name dynamically. Which is okay allows for some customization. Suppose
